intro: Tupeia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf tupeia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, adapting well to dry and sunny conditions. Tupeia microphylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
